trial_identification.studytitle: A Randomised, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study Assessing the Effect of Fenofibrate, Coenzyme Q10 and Their co-Administration on Ventricular Diastolic Function in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes
trial_identification.scientifictitle: A Randomised, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled Study Assessing the Effect of Fenofibrate, Coenzyme Q10 and Their co-Administration on Ventricular Diastolic Function in Patients With Type 2 Diabetes

Treatment: drugs - Fenofibrate/CoQ10 Treatment: drugs - Fenofibrate/CoQ10 Treatment: drugs - Fenofibrate/CoQ10 Treatment: drugs - Fenofibrate/CoQ10 Treatment: drugs - Fenofibrate/CoQ10 Treatment: drugs - Fenofibrate/CoQ10 Treatment: drugs - Fenofibrate/CoQ10

Treatment: drugs: Fenofibrate/CoQ10 Fenofibrate pbo/CoQ10 placebo
Treatment: drugs: Fenofibrate/CoQ10 Fenofibrate pbo/CoQ10 200 mg
Treatment: drugs: Fenofibrate/CoQ10 Fenofibrate 160mg/CoQ10 placebo

primaryOutcome.outcome: Evolution of the E'/E septal ratio

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Evolution of the Left atrium and right atrium volumes
Evolution of the Left and right sizes
Evolution of the LVEDD and LVESD
Evolution of the LVEDV and LVESV
Evolution of the LV ejection fraction
Evolution of the tissue Doppler E'/A' ratio
Evolution of the PV doppler parameters

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
- Men or women aged from 40 to 79 years
- Patients with pre-existing T2DM
- HbA1C <9%
- Written informed consent
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
- unable to comply with the protocol, Likely to leave the trial before completion
- having participated in an another trial 3Ã days before V1
- Pregnant or childbearing potential not using birth control method
- Type 1 diabetic patients, T2Dm insulin therapy
Patients with one of the following pathology:
- with muscular disorders known or increase CK , or hepatic deficiency or transaminase increase
- with symptomatic gall-bladder disease or/and renal insufficiency
- with abnormal thyroid function
- with proliferative retinopathy
- with recent cardiovascular event, uncontrolled hypertension
- with known chronic alcohol intake
- with other severe pathology
- with TC>= 7.0 mmol/L and/or TG>= 4mmol/L at V1
- Patients treated with Warfarin
- Patients with specific ECG dysfunction

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study was to study the effect of different combinations of fenofibrate and coenzyme Q10 on ventricular diastolic function in patients with Type II diabetes
